articles.headline: Stung by Low Oil Prices, Companies Face a Reckoning on Debts
articles.snippet: Virtually no wells in the United States are profitable to drill, forcing some companies to produce oil simply to pay their lenders.
articles.abstract: Virtually no wells in the United States are profitable to drill, forcing some companies to produce oil simply to pay their lenders.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIDLAND, Tex. — On the 15th floor of an office tower in Midland looms a five-foot-long trophy black bear, shot by the son of an executive at Caza Oil & Gas.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Michael Corkery

articles.headline: Donald Trump and Bernie Sanders Win in New Hampshire Primary
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump recovered from a humbling second-place finish in the Iowa caucuses; Mr. Sanders prevailed in a state where he has long held an advantage.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump recovered from a humbling second-place finish in the Iowa caucuses; Mr. Sanders prevailed in a state where he has long held an advantage.
articles.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H. — Donald J. Trump and Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont harnessed working-class fury on Tuesday to surge to commanding victories in a New Hampshire primary that drew a huge turnout across the state.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: New Online Tools Offer Path to Lower Drug Prices
articles.snippet: Most major pharmacies do not list the price of the drugs they sell, but two web companies are trying to make pricing information more transparent.
articles.abstract: Most major pharmacies do not list the price of the drugs they sell, but two web companies are trying to make pricing information more transparent.
articles.lead_paragraph: Americans have come to rely on their smartphones to help them do seemingly everything, like hailing a taxi and comparing prices of dog food.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Deals Blow to Obama’s Efforts to Regulate Coal Emissions
articles.snippet: The justices’ willingness to issue a stay while the case proceeds was a hint that the emissions program could face a skeptical reception.
articles.abstract: The justices’ willingness to issue a stay while the case proceeds was a hint that the emissions program could face a skeptical reception.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a major setback for President Obama’s climate change agenda, the Supreme Court on Tuesday temporarily blocked the administration’s effort to combat global warming by regulating emissions from coal-fired power plants.
articles.byline: By Adam Liptak and Coral Davenport

articles.headline: Obama’s Budget Seeks to Ease Economic Fears for U.S. Workers
articles.snippet: With his spending proposals, the president laid out a clear view of government’s role in the labor market, providing a detailed agenda to ease the anxieties of workers weighed down by job insecurity and income volatility.
articles.abstract: With his spending proposals, the president laid out a clear view of government’s role in the labor market, providing a detailed agenda to ease the anxieties of workers weighed down by job insecurity and income volatility.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At the center of the final budget of President Obama’s term is a concession that the major macroeconomic trends of the past two generations — particularly the loss of benefits that once went with formal employment relationships — are largely irreversible.

articles.headline: Backers Stayed With Donald Trump as He Regained His Bearings
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump’s victory gave the irrepressible celebrity candidate the status his opponents long feared, as a bona fide leader in the race.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump’s victory gave the irrepressible celebrity candidate the status his opponents long feared, as a bona fide leader in the race.
articles.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H. — After losing the Iowa caucuses, Donald J. Trump acted like a heavyweight champion who had just been knocked down.

articles.headline: Pregnancy Clinics Fight for Right to Deny Abortion Information
articles.snippet: Crisis pregnancy centers in California are in a battle with the state over a new law requiring them to post a notice that free or low-cost abortion care is available.
articles.abstract: Crisis pregnancy centers in California are in a battle with the state over a new law requiring them to post a notice that free or low-cost abortion care is available.
articles.lead_paragraph: EL CAJON, Calif. — “Free Pregnancy Testing,” reads the large sign in front of the East County Pregnancy Care Clinic, on a busy intersection of this impoverished city east of San Diego.

articles.headline: Janet Yellen Sounds a More Cautious Note on the U.S. Economy
articles.snippet: The Fed chairwoman, testifying before Congress, reiterated the central bank’s gradual approach to interest-rate increases.
articles.abstract: The Fed chairwoman, testifying before Congress, reiterated the central bank’s gradual approach to interest-rate increases.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Republicans described the Federal Reserve as ineffective, secretive and out of touch with the economic realities of ordinary Americans.
